cards.title: Eidolon
setup: At the start of the game, {Eidolon} enters play Absorbing Energy side up.
gameplay: If {Eidolon} has not yet been dealt damage this game, effects which reference the most recent damage type dealt to it deal energy damage.
After {Eidolon} is dealt damage, it becomes immune to that damage type.
Whenever an alteration card would enter play, {Eidolon} first deals each hero target 1 damage of the type most recently dealt to {Eidolon}.
At the start of the villain turn, if {Eidolon} makes itself immune to {H} or more damage types, {Eidolon} flips.
At the end of the villain turn, {Eidolon} deals the hero target with the lowest HP {H - 1} damage of the type most recently dealt to {Eidolon}.
flippedGameplay: At the start of the villain turn, if {Eidolon} did not flip this turn, {Eidolon} flips.

At the end of the villain turn, {Eidolon} ceases to make itself immune to any damage types. For each immunity removed this way, {Eidolon} deals the hero target with the highest HP 3 irreducible damage of that type.
cards.challengeText: Eidolon only flips to its Surging with Power side if it makes itself immune to {H + 2} or more damage types.

openingLines.GuardiansOfTomorrow.ScaleCharacter: Light in the void, you shall be snuffed.
openingLines.GuardiansOfTomorrow.GuardiansOfTomorrowS: Balance is weakness. Power is all.

cards.title: Chaos Storm
cards.body: Increase damage dealt by {Eidolon} by 1. When a hero character card would deal damage, you may change that damage to any damage type.
cards.flavorText: What the..? My projections are turning to{br}ice!

cards.title: Elemental Resonance
cards.body: The first time each turn a hero character card deals damage to {Eidolon}, {Eidolon} deals them 2 damage of the same type, then convert all damage they deal to the damage type used until the start of their next turn.
cards.flavorText: Flame to flame to flame to flame...

cards.title: Power Absorption
cards.body: When {Eidolon} is dealt damage, increase damage dealt by {Eidolon} by 1 until the end of the current turn.

cards.title: Frigid Carapace
cards.body: {Eidolon} deals itself 2 cold damage. If it takes damage this way, each hero must discard a card, otherwise {Eidolon} deals each non-villain target 2 cold damage.

cards.title: Cosmic Rays
cards.body: {Eidolon} deals itself 2 energy damage. If it takes damage this way, destroy {H - 1} hero ongoing cards, otherwise {Eidolon} deals each non-villain target 2 energy damage.
cards.flavorText: This power is a mirror of my own! I will{br}hold it off, you all run!
cards.flavorReference: High Balancer S-ri, Sage and Sinner #1

cards.title: Blazing Aura
cards.body: {Eidolon} deals itself 2 fire damage. If it takes damage this way, increase damage dealt by {Eidolon} by 1 until the end of the next villain turn, otherwise {Eidolon} deals each non-villain target 2 fire damage.
cards.flavorText: It's fighting fire with fire now!

cards.title: Unholy Essence
cards.body: {Eidolon} deals itself 2 infernal damage. If it takes damage this way, each hero must shuffle their trash into their deck, otherwise {Eidolon} deals each non-villain target 2 infernal damage.
cards.flavorText: The dark is the truth is the dark is the...

cards.title: Static Cloud
cards.body: {Eidolon} deals itself 2 lightning damage. If it takes damage this way, reduce damage dealt by hero targets by 1 until the start of the villain turn, otherwise {Eidolon} deals each non-villain target 2 lightning damage.

cards.title: Unreal Limbs
cards.body: {Eidolon} deals itself 2 melee damage. If it takes damage this way, the hero target with the lowest HP may not deal damage until the start of the villain turn, otherwise {Eidolon} deals each non-villain target 2 melee damage.
cards.flavorText: Augh! Help me out of here!

cards.title: Kinetic Spines
cards.body: {Eidolon} deals itself 2 projectile damage. If it takes damage this way, destroy all environment cards, otherwise {Eidolon} deals each non-villain target 2 projectile damage.

cards.title: Mental Block
cards.body: {Eidolon} deals itself 2 psychic damage. If it takes damage this way, heroes may not use powers until the start of the villain turn, otherwise {Eidolon} deals each non-villain target 2 psychic damage.

cards.title: Blinding Glow
cards.body: {Eidolon} deals itself 2 radiant damage. If it takes damage this way, the hero with the highest HP must discard 2 cards.
cards.flavorText: Light is pain is light is pain is...

cards.title: Unbalancing Screech
cards.body: {Eidolon} deals itself 2 sonic damage. If it takes damage this way, heroes may not play cards until the start of the villain turn, otherwise {Eidolon} deals each non-villain target 2 sonic damage.

cards.title: Corrosive Touch
cards.body: {Eidolon} deals itself 2 toxic damage. If it takes damage this way, destroy {H - 1} equipment cards, otherwise {Eidolon} deals each non-villain target 2 toxic damage.

cards.title: Progressive Alterations
cards.body: Shuffle all alteration cards from the villain trash into the villain deck. Play the top card of the villain deck.
cards.flavorText: If we wait for the next time it pulses, we{br}can hurt it!

cards.title: Chaotic Nature
cards.body: Reveal cards from the top of the villain deck until an Ongoing card is revealed. Put it into play and shuffle the other revealed cards into the villain deck. {Eidolon} deals each hero target {H - 2} damage of the type that was last dealt to it.
cards.flavorText: You know, I feel a weird kinship with this{br}thing. Its powers are a lot like mine,{br}just... out of control.

cards.title: Alteration Surge
cards.body: Reveal cards from the top of the villain deck until two Alteration cards are revealed. Put the revealed cards into play and shuffle the remaining cards into the villain deck.
cards.flavorText: It doesn't just draw power from our{br}attacks! It seems like it can alter itself{br}on its own.

cards.title: Strange Powers
cards.body: {Eidolon} deals the 2 hero targets with the most cards in play {H - 2} damage of the last type dealt to {Eidolon} each. Each hero dealt damage this way must destroy 2 of their non-character cards.
cards.flavorText: I don't know where it comes from or{br}what it is. I do know that it wants to{br}kill me.
